action.action-desc: Mr. Perry introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 23 and title 49, United States Code, to remove transit-oriented development projects as projects eligible for assistance under the transportation infrastructure finance and innovation program and the railroad rehabilitation and improvement financing program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Negating Obligations for Transit-Oriented Developments Act or the NO TOD Act.

section.header: Transportation infrastructure finance and innovation program

subsection.text: Section 601(a)(12) of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (F) through (H) as subparagraphs (E) through (G), respectively.

subsection.header: Determination of eligibility and project selection
subsection.text: Section 602(a) of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating clauses (iii) and (iv) as clauses (ii) and (iii), respectively; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a transit-oriented development project shall not be eligible to receive assistance under the TIFIA program.
In this paragraph, the term transit-oriented development project means a project or components of a project designed for commercial or residential use.

subsection.text: Section 608(a)(4) of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking (B) Airport-related projects and all that follows through The Secretary and inserting The Secretary.

subsection.text: This section and the amendments made by this section shall apply to project applications submitted on or after the date of enactment of this Act.
Section 22402 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (D) by inserting or at the end;
in subparagraph (E) by striking ; or and inserting a period at the end; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (c)(6) by striking and increase transit-oriented development.

subsection.text: This section and the amendments made by this section shall apply to applications for direct loans or guaranteed loans submitted on or after the date of enactment of this Act.

section.header: Elimination of transit-oriented development planning pilot program
section.text: Section 20005 of MAP–21 (49 U.S.C. 5303 note) is amended by striking subsection (b).
